column4: Hi #ubuntu, I'm trying to downgrade a package (libapache2-mod-python), but ubuntu just won't let me. Can anyone advice on the proper way to do such a thing? My failed attempt is shown here: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/59040/
there is no "proper" way to downgrade -- only a forced one: use --force-downgrade (as per man dpkg)
thanks for your response, I tried --force-downgrade, but the output is similar: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/59041/
it still does this "unpacking replacement libapache2-mod-python" which is a newer package that I don't want
